alert.note: Alert for Georgetown; Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 1:55PM EDT until August 12 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... Southwestern Horry County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 155 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring along parts of Highway 17 and 5th Ave South. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach, Socastee, Red Hill, Garden City, Myrtle Beach Airport, Bucksville, Bucksport, Forestbrook, Burgess, Yauhannah and Grand Strand Regional Medical Center. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
